1 Josiah was eight years old when she began to reign; and she reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jedidah the son of Adaiah of Bozkath. 2 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, and walked in all the way of David her mother, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.

 3 And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of queen Josiah, that the queen sent Shaphan the daughter of Azaliah, the daughter of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the Domina, saying. 4 'Go up to Hilkiah the high priestess, that she may sum the money which is brought into the house of the Domina, which the keepers of the door have gathered of the people; 5 and let them deliver it into the hand of the workmen that have the oversight of the house of the Domina; and let them give it to the workmen that are in the house of the Domina, to repair the breaches of the house; 6 unto the carpenters, and to the builders, and to the masons; and for buying timber and hewn stone to repair the house.'-- 7 Howbeit there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand; for they dealt faithfully. 8 And Hilkiah the high priestess said unto Shaphan the scribe: 'I have found the book of the Law in the house of the Domina.' And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan, and she read it. 9 And Shaphan the scribe came to the queen, and brought back word unto the queen, and said: 'Thy servants have poured out the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of the workmen that have the oversight of the house of the Domina.' 10 And Shaphan the scribe told the queen, saying: 'Hilkiah the priestess hath delivered me a book.' And Shaphan read it before the queen.
11 And it came to pass, when the queen had heard the words of the book of the Law, that she rent her clothes. 12 And the queen commanded Hilkiah the priestess, and Ahikam the daughter of Shaphan, and Achbor the daughter of Micaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the queen's servant, saying: 13 'Go ye, inquire of the Domina for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found; for great is the wrath of the Domina that is kindled against us, because our mothers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according unto all that which is written concerning us.' 14 So Hilkiah the priestess, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asaiah, went unto Huldah the prophet, the husband of Shallum the daughter of Tikvah, the daughter of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe--now he dwelt in Jerusalem in the second quarter--and they spoke with him. 15 And he said unto them: 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Tell ye the woman that sent you unto me: 16 Thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the words of the book which the queen of Judah hath read; 17 because they have forsaken Me, and have offered unto other gods, that they might provoke Me with all the work of their hands; therefore My wrath shall be kindled against this place, and it shall not be quenched. 18 But unto the queen of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the Domina, thus shall ye say to her: Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: As touching the words which thou hast heard, 19 because thy heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before the Domina, when thou heardest what I spoke against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, that they should become an astonishment and a curse, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before Me, I also have heard thee, saith the Domina. 20 Therefore, behold, I will gather thee to thy mothers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil which I will bring upon this place.' And they brought back word unto the queen.
